comment: He was a preferential bully, supporting some more than others. His assigned readings were off topic, and overwhelming in a way that felt targeted. He was consistently late and/or absent, talking to me at the last min of class and leaving mid talk. I only passed my thesis thanks to the help of outside professors. My advice is to hope you're liked.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Seti only treats you with respect if you've had his cultures/studio before. Otherwise, you get alienated. He's proven to be extremely prideful and petty. He forces the same research template on everyone despite varied concepts & requires diagrams that don't really support your thesis.  This "educator" will try to humiliate you during review. AVOID!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Seti has a habit of treating his students poorly in a way that only tenured professors can get away with. He is an angry and petty person. He spent 16 years working incredibly hard towards his PHD and chooses year after year to use this accomplishment to bully his students academically. Do not take any of his sections if you can help it.

Unfortunate that this website prevents you from claiming that the professor shows bias or favoritism - if you've witnessed his ‘pedagogy' first hand you'd know how perfectly this could be used to describe him. Setiawan does not care for the mental health of his students, and seems to get gratification from pushing them to their breaking point.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Great choice for a studio professor if you want to be pushed to your full potential. He will recommend ideas that he thinks best apply to your work, and it's best if you take his suggestions. He follows the year's standards closely and loves to go back to foundational skills if you're lacking in any areas. You must put in the effort though.

Do not take Professor Setiawan unless necessary. He was VERY strict about coming to class, and severely enforces the universities attendance rule. He grades based on 2 exams, weekly pop quizzes, 3 questions you have to create each week, a group project, and two essays. You can hardly understand his lectures, and just reads off slides.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: He looks for specific answers on the pop quizzes in which you only have 15 mins to do. It's hard to understand what he is saying, not bc he has an accent but bc he always mumbles. He never gives feedback on your work and you won't know your average grade until the end of the semester. This had the whole class worrying bc everyone failed every quiz.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He's a great choice for a first-year. He pushes you to be creative and sustain the course load, which is important for the major. Things are due for each class, which prepares you for future studios. Although, it can hurt the neatness or quality of some of your work, depending on your working style. He can be fun and enjoyable. You'll learn a lot!

The entire class is cheating during his quizzes but i dont have the online textbook so i cant cheat. He expects us to remember the littlest details of a 40 page textbook read and grades us harshly on those answers. Every week. And those quizzes are pop quizzes -_-
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I would not recommend this teacher to anyone for ARCH 1001. He is hard to understand because of his accent and he makes you read a ridiculous amount just to give random pop quizzes and fail everyone. Most people will fail every pop quiz. You feel like you're going to fail the class all semester long. Its bad and stressful for first-year students.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: As a thesis adviser, Setiawan is either hit or miss. He is not clear on his expectations and if he does not like the direction your taking your thesis, he's not too supportive. For a pass/fail 1-credit course, he wants you to dedicate a lot more time than other advisers and its sometimes extremely stressful
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Setiawan's ARCH1000 class had me worried all semester because the whole class fails almost all pop quizzes and test, but everyone ends up being fine. Work harder than you think you should on essays and exercises, and you'll do fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Setiawan's class can be hard. If you take his class, you will be worried and stressed out the whole semester because the pop quizzes(x3) affect your grade greatly. Just make sure you make your drawings and reports good work and you will be fine in his class. Also communicate with him through email or in person and he will respect that.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: In my opinion, he is not a good professor. First, he has a strong accent and it is hard to understand most things he says. He never gives clear instructions. He will make you do the same assignment five times just for fun. He is rude and doesn't care about hurting anyone's feelings. He doesn't care about work in other classes you take.

I had him for Studio 2, and I learned so much form him! He is very intelligent, and he takes time to help students as long as he can see that they are putting in the work and effort that he expects (which is high). He will expect you to produce alot, but your craft quality and time managment skills will be greatly impoved.
Just one of those classes you have to get through. Do all the assignments with no nonsense and you'll probably get an A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Setiawan's class was challenging BUT also fun. He has a speech problem, but you'll definitely start understanding what he expects. His class is tough; he assigns HW every day, but they're meant to help you practice & better your craftsmanship. He has HIGH EXPECTATION, so expect to show your best work. He also gives a lot of good feedback, just ask!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Setiawan is a great professor BUT you're going to be doing a LOT of work in his class. However, he's very knowledgeable and is eager to help. His class was tough but you learn a lot. I know y'all probably don't care about any of that. Neither do I when registering for classes, but if you're stuck with his class... you'll survive.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: The work he gives you is repetitive, but helps you understand the assignment better.  Sometimes difficult to understand him talk, but overall he will make you better when you put in the work.

There is a reason people stay away from him. He is a very hard teacher, however, you will learn more in his class than in any other. I never pulled an all nighter and still made an A in his class so I know anyone can take his class and do good. He is a hard person to understand sometimes.

I had Setiawan for first year ARCH studio. You will always have homework and you will constantly be redoing projects that don't meet his expectations. It will be a long and painful semester with precious few moments of sleep. Despite all this i never regretted taking him, it definitely gave me an upper hand against the other students.
He's one of those strict teachers that make you better as a Student, Setiawan will always make you think and explain thoughts clearly.
He has some speech problems, however, he will help you as much as you ask.

His cultures class is murder. I love essays but my god we wrote one per week and his tests and quizzes are short essays and his discussions...I wrote at very least 30 essays in that class. He's a clear teacher so that's good. And as long as you do the essays and read the book you'll be fine, of course, that is A LOT of reading. I did learn plenty.

Professor Setiawan is by far my favorite teacher. I have taken him for multiple classes and he is constantly helpful in anyway possible. At first he is difficult to understand but he will reword or repeat if needed. His classes require work. You will never make anything higher than a 95. There is always room for improvement in your work after all.

His english is fair and if you listen to him it'll be easy to understand.Sit in the front row if youre hard of hearing.The course load is really heavy,he makes sure you do your reading assignments, and he cares about the bigger picture of architecture than just memorizing dates and architects.Youll learn more in his class. He values idea over dates

I had his for cultures 1...he gives a lot of homework, his accent is a little hard to understand but he is always willing to help without hesitation. Try to get on his good side and you will be fine. He is a good professor and very knowledgeable

Listen closely; he gives all the information needed. He prepares you for future, so don't throw away this knowledge. In one day I've learned more than I have learned in months with previous instructor.

Setiawan has high expectations, however he is willing to talk everything out with you if you are PREPARED. You can not slack and expect him to take you seriously. You also have to ask questions, especially if you don't understand his English.

Arief was an awesome teacher, learned alot from him, yes he has speech issues, draws on your work, but he is helping you to understand. Always willing to help, laid back, recommend you take him, be prepared to work, I got a B in the class.

Stay Away! Doesn't respect ppl Draws all over the stuff you plan to present Has speech issues. In the wrong profession. Is never satisfied no matter how good your work is. Had review nearly everyday. After studio most ppl never wanna take him again. The worst of them all!!!

Avoid by all means unless you're good at deciphering alien languages! Your talent is irrelevant if he doesn't like you. I was subjected to his unfair treatment even though I was at the top of the class. You can't learn if you can't understand the teacher!
Avoid my all means unless you are good at deciphering alien languages!
never understood what he wanted.

He is a very knowledgeable teacher who will help you with your design. Some are thrown back by the fact that his English is not that good, but he is overall a very helpful person. Grading with studio classes are always somewhat subjective, so unfair grading will always be thrown against these teachers

Arief is a good teacher. He may not be the easiest to understand, but he is one of the most knowledgeable teachers I've met. He will always help if you ask, and is a pretty laid back teacher.  He tries to expose you to different types of design process, and makes you study good architecture.  Take him...he isn't bad and is pretty cool.
If you desire to learn anything, then DO NOT take his class.  Nice guy, but hard to understand at times
No Comments

Ok Teacher, Easy grades, Yet I didn't learn a lot from him. He could have been more direct and fair. It seems like the ones not doing work still get B's with the ones that try. But if you really spend time in your project and he knows than it's an A, but you still look back and wonder what you got out of it. Don't take him if you want to LEARN
